threads.author: nuclearmaster100
threads.content: and keep in mind it is illegal to tamper with electronics that don't belong to you, it depends on what you mean by "wipe" and how you do it

threads.author: nuclearmaster100
threads.content: factory reset performed by/with the assitance of IT because of a software or firmware issue? awesome

threads.author: nuclearmaster100
threads.content: nuking it and trying to install a custom os or something?

threads.author: nuclearmaster100
threads.content: nada

threads.author: nuclearmaster100
threads.content: i mean it's a chormebook so that example is probably bad

threads.author: nuclearmaster100
threads.content: lol

threads.author: nuclearmaster100
threads.content: but ykwim

threads.author: nuclearmaster100
threads.content: if you just want to remove all your user data you can probably do that manually with all honesty lol, it depends how much you have

threads.author: nuclearmaster100
threads.content: wiping it completely on the level of the os would mean creating new users which is something you'd need admin for

threads.author: nuclearmaster100
threads.content: same with changing os or modifying firmware, in fact if it belongs to the school it most likely has a secure boot bios password

threads.author: nuclearmaster100
threads.content: but yeah it's probably not just against school policy but also illegal depending on where you live, assuming it belongs to the school

threads.author: _cosmicecho
threads.content:
Thank you

Actually my hobby is just simple for now - to understand how to defend my laptop XD firmware reflashing is the sort of recovery phase if all defenses fail and a compromise happens

threads.author: _cosmicecho
threads.content:
yooo,

So there's an even deeper form of spyware called hardware implants

Because it is implanted on the hardware itself, and its probably purely physical

Just buy from the right supplier and manufacturer though it should be almost zero

https://www.ghtinc.com/supply-chain-security-addressing-serialization-risks-and-hardware-implants-in-information-security/

threads.author: loredous
threads.content: To put this in perspective, the chances of having compromised hardware are almost zero. Typically this is going to be something that is specifically targeted towards a device or entity. Most often it will be high-end networking equipment.

threads.author: _cosmicecho
threads.content: Thanks for the info
